title: Token Distribution
description: Check the token distribution mechanisms.
whitepaper: The MKR token's distribution mechanism includes a Debt Auction process for recapitalization of the Maker Protocol when system debt exceeds the surplus. This can result in an increase in the MKR token supply. MKR holders are incentivized to govern the ecosystem responsibly to avoid such situations. The provided context does not mention other specific distribution mechanisms such as sales, airdrops, rewards, staking, or liquidity mining. code: The MKR token distribution mechanism includes a Burn Mechanism where the token supply may decrease when the system surplus exceeds debt, and a Debt Auction process where the token supply may increase to recapitalize the system if the system debt exceeds the surplus. This incentivizes MKR holders to govern the Maker ecosystem responsibly.

title: Token Distribution
description: Check the token distribution mechanisms.
whitepaper: The MKR token distribution mechanism includes a Burn Mechanism, where MKR tokens can be burned as part of the system's stability fee process. Additionally, MKR tokens can be minted through a Debt Auction to recapitalize the system if the Maker Protocol's system debt exceeds the surplus. There is also an aspect of Treasury/Fund Allocation, where MKR holders can vote on governance decisions that may include allocating funds for the maintenance and improvement of the Maker Protocol. The provided context does not mention other distribution mechanisms such as Initial Allocation/Constructor, Sale, Airdrop, Reward, Stake, Claims, Dividends, Faucet, Bounties, Vesting, Liquidity Mining, Farming/Yield Farming, Payment for Services/Work, Lottery/Raffle, or Referral Program.
code: The MKR token distribution mechanism includes a Burn Mechanism where MKR tokens are burned as part of the system's stability fee process, and a Debt Auction process to recapitalize the system if necessary. There is also an aspect of Treasury/Fund Allocation where governance can allocate funds for the maintenance and improvement of the Maker Protocol. The provided context does not mention other distribution mechanisms such as Mint, Initial Allocation, Sale, Airdrop, Reward, Stake, Claims, Dividends, Faucet, Bounties, Vesting, Liquidity Mining, Farming/Yield Farming, Payment for Services/Work, Lottery/Raffle, or Referral Program.
